main event: A bright object 50 times brighter than the brightest star was observed for over an hour in Dayton, Ohio on multiple days.
interesting points: The object was observed on Monday and Wednesday, but not on Tuesday.
The object was at a 45 degree elevation in the east and appeared to move north.
The object was still in the east at 10:30 PM.
The object was possibly a satellite, balloon, aircraft, or the planet Jupiter.
Further data was needed for a full evaluation.
sighted object: bright object 50 times brighter than the brightest star
